intro: Diplocalyx tomentellus, commonly known as the woolly diplocalyx, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
